qas.question: At what establishment was the circular bar introduced?

context: <a0_0>Isambard Kingdom Brunel<a0_0/>, the <a3_0>British<a3_0/> <a2_0>engineer and railway builder<a2_0/>, introduced the idea of a circular bar into the <a1_0>Swindon station pub<a1_0/> in order that customers were served quickly and did not delay his trains. These island bars became popular as they also allowed staff to serve customers in several different rooms surrounding the bar.
